intro: Roucheria calophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved roucheria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat. Roucheria calophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
